      The identity domain associated with the given user
      String getPassword()
      The password for the user
      String getServer()
      Returns the server name, which does not contain the scheme or anything after the TLD suffix, such as our-company-pbcs-server.pbcs.us2.oraclecloud.com.
      String getUsername()
      The username used to connect to the PBCS instance
      String toString()

    • Constructor Detail

      • PbcsConnectionImpl

        public PbcsConnectionImpl(String server,
                          String identityDomain,
                          String username,
                          String password)
        Builds a new PBCS Connection object. None of the fields may be null or otherwise empty, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        server - the server, not including http and not containing anything after the TLD
        identityDomain - the identity domain for the user
        username - the username to connect with
        password - the password for the user

      • PbcsConnectionImpl

        public PbcsConnectionImpl(String server,
                          String identityDomain,
                          String username)
        Builds a new PBCS Connection object. None of the fields may be null or otherwise empty, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

        This overload constructor is provided as a convenience and meant to be used immediately afterwith with the withBase64Password(String) method to set the password.

        Parameters:
        server - the server, not including http and not containing anything after the TLD
        identityDomain - the identity domain for the user
        username - the username to connect with

    • Method Detail

      • withBase64Password

        public PbcsConnectionImpl withBase64Password(String encodedPassword)
        Returns this connection object updated with a new password that is provided as a string with Base64 encoding. This is not meant to provide robust security, but rather to allow for putting passwords into other scripts/code that might otherwise be exposed via a screenshot or during editing (like a Jython script in ODI/FDMEE).
        Parameters:
        encodedPassword - the Base64 (UTF-8) encoded password.
        Returns:
        an updated connection object with the password set to the decoded value of the given string

      • getServer

        public String getServer()
        Description copied from interface: PbcsConnection
        Returns the server name, which does not contain the scheme or anything after the TLD suffix, such as our-company-pbcs-server.pbcs.us2.oraclecloud.com.
        Specified by:
        getServer in interface PbcsConnection
        Returns:
        the PBCS server name

      • fromProperties

        public static PbcsConnectionImpl fromProperties(Properties properties)
        Convenience method that attempts to construct a new user connection details object from a Properties object that contains the following keys: server, identityDomain, username, password.

        If any of the fields are missing, an exception is thrown

        Parameters:
        properties - a Properties object that shouold contain the user details
        Returns:
        a new user connection details object based on the keys from the given properties
